metadata.title: SUPPLEMENTARY FILE -INTERVIEW GUIDES: HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS AND PEOPLE AFFECTED BY CANCER

body_text.text: • Have you been on a prescribing course and if so which one?
• How do you keep up to date with prescribing given how new immunotherapy is as a pathway?
Section 2: Understandings of immunotherapy • To start, please could you tell me in your own words what your understanding of cancer immunotherapy treatment is and how it works?
• What does your role in supporting cancer immunotherapy entail?
• Please could you tell me a bit about your experience of caring for/ supporting people being treated with cancer immunotherapy with immune checkpoint inhibitors?
• What do you think are patients' priorities and expectations of treatment?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • How do patients respond to support?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • How is information about immunotherapy treatment communicated to patients?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • Do you have training on how to help patients make decisions? Do you have training on how to explore patients' unmet needs?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • What psychological support is offered to patients? • How is treatment/support delivered out of hours?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • How do you support patients' self-management?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • Do professionals experience uncertainty in prescribing/delivering treatment and support for immunotherapy?
body_text.section: Section 4: Information giving, support and patient expectations

body_text.text: • What would you say has particularly prepared you for prescribing or supporting immunotherapy treatment/care?

• What knowledge and skills do healthcare professionals (doctors/nurses/pharmacists) need to provide safe and effective high-quality care and support for people being treated with cancer immunotherapy?
• What aspects of cancer immunotherapy would you like to know more about and why?
• How might your ongoing immunotherapy education and training needs be best addressed?
• What are the challenges for you of accessing education and training?

• Why is it important that healthcare professionals working in other care settings, for example, emergency admissions, general practice, primary care and acute hospital settings know about and understand cancer immunotherapy treatment regimes?
• What education is available to patients?
• How is knowledge disseminated across multi-professional teams?
• What are your thoughts on certification for immunotherapy?
• Overall, how would you describe your experience providing immunotherapy treatment to date?
• What has been the influence of COVID-19?

• Is there anything else you would like to add? BIBREF0.title: Did you have any concerns about immunotherapy? If so, what were they and how were these dealt with? Section 6: Immunotherapy treatment experience 13. Can you tell me about your immunotherapy treatment experience? 14. What has your experience been like between each treatment cycle? 15. Have you experienced any side effects? If so

TABREF0.text: Section 5: Delivery of effective care/support• How do you define effective care/ support?
